greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Sum of the areas of all bargraphs of site-perimeter n.
comment: A bargraph is a polyomino whose bottom is a segment of the nonnegative x-axis and whose upper part is a lattice path starting at (0,0) and ending with its first return to the x-axis using steps U=(0,1), D=(0,-1) and H=(1,0), where UD and DU are not allowed.
The site-perimeter of a polyomino is the number of exterior cells having a common edge with at least one polyomino cell.
link: Alois P. Heinz, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..820
M. Bousquet-Mélou and A. Rechnitzer, The site-perimeter of bargraphs, Adv. in Appl. Math. 31 (2003), 86-112.
results.author: _Alois P. Heinz_, Jun 13 2016
